newsitem.title: ITALY: Tietmeyer says German recovery will help Europe.
newsitem.headline: Tietmeyer says German recovery will help Europe.

text.p: Bundesbank president Hans Tietmeyer said Germany's economic recovery will help other countries to meet Maastricht criteria, but structural problems must be solved by individual states.
Tietmeyer told Italian television at an international conference here, "the German recovery is positive for Germany and for other countries as well.
"But the Maastricht criteria problems must be solved in each country," he said at this northern Italian lakeside resort.
"Structural problems such as deficit problems must be solved there (in each country)," he said.
Asked about German interest rates he said, "our policy is one of a steady hand. We have decided and now we shall wait and see. We will decide later."
